column4: is there something i need to install to use the "make" command?
oh, wonderful, guess I came at the right time

Hi, I'm trying to compile a library (libid3tag) because I couldn't find it in the repository.  To "make" it, it required another library, zlib, which isn't in the repository.  After downloading them both and compiling zlib, libid3tag still doesn't find zlib installed.  Am I doing something wrong, or is there an easier way?
i have lib3tag0 installed, but another library I'm trying to compile is calling for lib3tag... is there some way to tell it to use libid3tag0 ?
i'm a little new to linux, is there somewhere i can learn about a symlink?
what's the actual error you're getting (use the pastebin if it's more than 1 line)
i'm not sure that a symlink is the right solution (not avoiding answering) :)
ok, i'll tell you if that works
i found that out by doing '/msg ubotu find id3tag.h' and that file is in the libid3tag0-dev package
you can also do package contents searches via http://packages.ubuntu.com
looks like it worked.  thanks for your help
